answers.answer:
For use only:
1. As a thickening agent for natural rubber latex coatings, provided it is used at a level not to exceed 2 percent by weight of coating solids.
2. As a pigment dispersant in coatings at a level not to exceed 0.25 percent by weight of pigment

answers.answer:
Zinc chloride is added to the raw kaolin as a processing aid (corrosion inhibitor) early in the procssing of the product, at a trace level.
The majority of this inhibitor is consumed during processing.

answers.answer:
Sodium dithionite is added to the raw kaolin as a processing aid to remove iron
decolourants. This chemical is very reactive and is entirely eliminated in downstream processes via natural aeration and dewatering, and is not detectable in the final product.
